      • canWrap

        public static boolean canWrap​(java.util.List<InputSlot<?>> inputs,
                              java.util.List<OutputSlot<?>> outputs)
        Check whether the combination of InputSlots and OutputSlots describe more than one Operator.
        Parameters:
        inputs - said InputSlots
        outputs - said OutputSlots
        Returns:
        whether it is worth wrapping

      • wrap

        public static void wrap​(Operator wrappee,
                        OperatorContainer wrapper)
        Wraps an Operator in an OperatorContainer.
        See Also:
        wrap(List, List, OperatorContainer)

      • wrap

        public static void wrap​(java.util.List<InputSlot<?>> inputs,
                        java.util.List<OutputSlot<?>> outputs,
                        OperatorContainer container)
        Wraps the Operators between the given InputSlots and OutputSlots in the given OperatorContainer.

        In detail, the corresponding CompositeOperator's Slots are created and intercept the given Slots occupants/"occupees". The wrapped Operators are assigned the given OperatorContainer as container.

        Parameters:
        inputs - mentioned InputSlots, aligned with the CompositeOperator's InputSlots
        outputs - mentioned OutputSlots, aligned with the CompositeOperator's OutputSlots
        container - that should wrap the subplan

      • move

        public static void move​(OperatorContainer source,
                        OperatorContainer target)
        Moves the contained Operators from a source to a target OperatorContainer.
        Parameters:
        source - OperatorContainer whose CompositeOperator has identical Slots as that of the target
        target - OperatorContainer whose CompositeOperator has identical Slots as that of the source
